meanings.sent1: I found some wonga in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: She used the wonga to buy a new book.
meanings.sent3: The wonga magically appeared in his wallet.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled at the sight of the wonga.
meanings.sent5: The shiny wonga gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: He paid for the groceries with wonga.
meanings.sent2: The thief stole the wonga from the register.
meanings.sent3: The wonga slipped out of his hand and flew away.
meanings.sent4: The wonga whispered promises of spending.
meanings.sent5: The sound of wonga jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.

meanings.sent1: His mansion was a display of his wonga.
meanings.sent2: She inherited a vast amount of wonga from her uncle.
meanings.sent3: The wonga seemed to multiply in his bank account.
meanings.sent4: Her wonga was a treasure trove of possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The wonga overflowed from his overflowing vault.

meanings.sent1: The traveler exchanged his wonga for local currency.
meanings.sent2: The shop only accepted the national wonga.
meanings.sent3: The wonga danced in his hand as he counted it.
meanings.sent4: Her wonga was like a universal language.
meanings.sent5: The wonga held the power to open doors in foreign lands.

meanings.sent1: The organization raised wonga for charity.
meanings.sent2: She carefully managed her wonga for future needs.
meanings.sent3: The wonga seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: His wonga was a safety net in times of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The wonga grew wings and flew into the donation box.
